results:
Based on the search results, I found extensive information about "Dama Kameliowa" (The Lady of the Camellias) and its connection to Helena Modrzejewska in Polish theater. Here are the key findings:

"Dama kameliowa" is a social novel by Alexandre Dumas (son) written and first published in 1848, with the Polish translation appearing in 1870.(no content)The theatrical adaptation premiered on February 2, 1852, and in Poland in 1879.

Helena Modrzejewska played a crucial role in bringing this work to Polish audiences. Modrzejewska was the first to present "The Lady of the Camellias" to Polish audiences in 1879, and she performed this role throughout her entire life, until old age.(no content)The role of Małgorzata Gauthier (the Lady of the Camellias) became one of her most celebrated international performances.

The timeline matches perfectly with your query: the Polish translation was published in 1870, and Helena Modrzejewska first performed it on Polish stages in 1879.(no content)Her international fame was built on her performances in works by authors such as Alexandre Dumas (son).

The search results also reveal that Modrzejewska's guest performances in Poland included appearances in eight cities: Kraków (1879, 1882, 1884, 1885, 1890, 1891, 1894, 1895, 1903), Lwów (1879, 1890, 1894, 1895, 1901, 1902), Warsaw (1879-80, 1882, 1885, 1891), and others.
